text:
Question 63) For thousands of years man has been using biotechnology for the production of foods such as breads, beers and wines. In the manufacture of bread, for example, unicellular fungi, called yeast, are used, which are marketed as biological yeast. They are used to promote mass growth, leaving it light and soft.
The growth of bread mass by the mentioned process is the result of
A) liberation of carbon dioxide.
B) formation of lactic acid.
C) water formation.
D) ATP production.
E) heat release.
